sys_hub_action_type_definition.description:
Updates specified route table.

Inputs :

  • Tenancy ID -OCID of the tenancy.
  • Compartment ID -OCID of the compartment contains the route table.
  • Display Name - User-friendly name.
  • Route Table ID -Route table's Oracle ID (OCID).
  • Route Rules -Collection of rules used for routing destination IPs to network devices.
  • Free Form Tags -Free-form tags for this resource.

Outputs :

  • Status - If the request is executed successfully, Status is set to “Success”. If there is a failure, Status is set to “Error”.
  • Error Message -Reason for error, along with code. Populated only when an error occurs.
  • Defined Tags -Defined tags for this resource.
  • Lifecycle State -Route table's current state.
  • Network ID -OCID of the VCN the route table list belongs to.
  • Time Created -Date and time the route table was created.

Error Messages :

  • Bad Request.
  • Unauthorized.
  • Not Found.
  • Internal Server Error.

To use this action, the corresponding Oracle connection and credential must be created and associated with the Oracle Connection & Credential alias. Learn More

Note: Requires a subscription for production use. Read More.

sys_hub_action_type_snapshot.description:
Updates specified route table.

Inputs :

  • Tenancy ID -OCID of the tenancy.
  • Compartment ID -OCID of the compartment contains the route table.
  • Display Name - User-friendly name.
  • Route Table ID -Route table's Oracle ID (OCID).
  • Route Rules -Collection of rules used for routing destination IPs to network devices.
  • Free Form Tags -Free-form tags for this resource.

Outputs :

  • Status - If the request is executed successfully, Status is set to “Success”. If there is a failure, Status is set to “Error”.
  • Error Message -Reason for error, along with code. Populated only when an error occurs.
  • Defined Tags -Defined tags for this resource.
  • Lifecycle State -Route table's current state.
  • Network ID -OCID of the VCN the route table list belongs to.
  • Time Created -Date and time the route table was created.

Error Messages :

  • Bad Request.
  • Unauthorized.
  • Not Found.
  • Internal Server Error.

To use this action, the corresponding Oracle connection and credential must be created and associated with the Oracle Connection & Credential alias. Learn More

Note: Requires a subscription for production use. Read More.
